title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-24.4 - Designation of base year rolls

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-24.4 - Designation of base year rolls

State Regulations
(a) For the 1989 survey, the base year roll
for each municipality is the 1986 roll, except that for certain assessing
units, the base year rolls are as follows: (1)

For the city of New York, the 1987
assessment roll. (2)

For a
homestead assessing unit which was not a homestead assessing unit for the 1986
survey, the assessment roll used for the homestead base percentage or an
assessment roll subsequent to the assessment roll used for the homestead base
percentage. (3)

For a homestead
assessing unit which was a homestead assessing unit for the 1986 survey and
used a 1986 base year roll for the 1986 survey, the 1986 roll. (4)

For a municipality incorporated after the
1989 survey has begun or a village which is not an assessing unit and becomes a
village school assessing unit after the 1989 survey has begun, the first
available final assessment roll. If a survey subsequent to the 1989 survey has
begun, the determinations of sample class size, number of intervals, interval
sample size, boundary and contents of intervals and supplemental sample shall
be made in accordance with the procedures for such subsequent survey. (5)

For a city or town in which there has
been a change in level of assessment of 15 percent or more on the 1987
assessment roll, the 1987 assessment roll. (6)

For a city or town which lies wholly or
partially within a county in which there have been changes in level of
assessment of 15 percent or more on the 1987 assessment rolls of a majority of
the cities or towns, the 1987 assessment roll. (7)

For a village school assessing unit, the
1985 assessment roll. (8)

For a
nonhomestead village assessing unit in Nassau County the base year roll is
designated in accordance with section
8186-24.13
of this Subpart. (9)

For all other
villages, a base year roll is not designated. (10)

For the Amityville and Wyandanch School

Districts, the part of the 1986 assessment roll of the Town of Babylon which
constitutes the school district segment in the town. (b) Each municipality shall furnish to ORPTS
a copy of the final assessment roll designated as the base year roll for that
municipality within 30 days upon request of ORPTS. The municipality may be
reimbursed for forwarding this roll in the manner and in the amounts prescribed
by former 9 NYCRR section 190-5.3, as repealed in 1998, regardless of the
manner in which the roll was prepared. (c) Notwithstanding the provisions of
sections
8186-24.5, 8186-24.6, 8186-24.7, 8186-24.8, 8186-24.10
and
8186-24.12
of this Subpart, where the 1986 survey base year roll is reused pursuant to
this section, the following procedures shall be followed: (1)

The 1989 survey shall be performed on the
classified roll prepared for the 1986 survey. (2)

The stratification for the 1989 survey
shall be the same as was used for the 1986 survey. (3)

The sample parcels that were appraised
for the 1986 survey shall be reappraised for the 1989 survey. (4)

The data collected for the 1986 survey
appraisals may be reused when appraising the same sample parcels for the 1989
survey. (5)

The supplemental sample
determined for the 1986 survey pursuant to former 9 NYCRR Subpart
186-22, as
repealed in 1996 shall be reused for the 1989 survey. Notes
